ThingDef.description: A short-sleeved armor with pauldrons and chest plates covering the torso.
ThingDef.label: Combat Armor

ThingDef.description: The Van Graff combat armor is colored matte black for "brand recognition purposes," but has no matching black helmet.
ThingDef.label: Van GraffCombat Armor

ThingDef.description: The combat armor was the standard-issue armor of the US army before the war. It is composed of armor plates made from defensive polymer attached to pieces of ballistic fibre. It offers more protection than metal armor, while being somewhat lighter. It is rare and expensive since few groups have the knowledge, and resources, to produce more and many suits are scavenged from pre-war military caches. While still rare, the light combat armor is the most available variant. It offers quite good protection while being lightweight.
ThingDef.label: Combat Armor Light

ThingDef.description: The combat armor was the standard-issue armor of the US army before the war. It is composed of armor plates made from defensive polymer attached to pieces of ballistic fibre. It offers more protection than metal armor, while being somewhat lighter. It is rare and expensive since few groups have the knowledge, and resources, to produce more and many suits are scavenged from pre-war military caches. Medium combat armor provides great protection, albeit it is quite heavy. Itâ€™s best suited for warriors in the midst of battle.
ThingDef.label: Combat Armor Sturdy

ThingDef.description: The combat armor was the standard-issue armor of the US army before the war. It is composed of armor plates made from defensive polymer attached to pieces of ballistic fibre. It offers more protection than metal armor, while being somewhat lighter. It is rare and expensive since few groups have the knowledge, and resources, to produce more and many suits are scavenged from pre-war military caches. Exotic and powerful, heavy combat armor offers superior protection against all kinds of damage. Obviously, it is very heavy, but only power armor guards its wearer better against the perils of the wasteland.
ThingDef.label: Combat Armor Heavy
Reinforced Combat Armor
ThingDef.description: A more advanced version of the standard combat armor.

ThingDef.label: Reinforced Combat Armor II
ThingDef.description: An even more advanced version of the reinforced combat armor, offering more protection.

ThingDef.label: Military Fatigues
ThingDef.description: The military fatigues consist of a dirty set of pea-green fatigues with black boots.

ThingDef.label: Benny
ThingDef.description: Benny's suit is a black and white buffalo plaid suit jacket worn with light grey dress pants, white dress shirt, and black tie.

ThingDef.label: Mysterious Stranger
ThingDef.description: Mysterious Strangers outfit.

ThingDef.label: Business Pre War
ThingDef.description: A light beige suit with a blue tie.

ThingDef.label: Spring Pre War Dress
ThingDef.description: A pink dress with red heels.

ThingDef.label: Spring Pre War Shirt
ThingDef.description: A red plaid shirt and brown pants.

ThingDef.label: Radiations Suit
ThingDef.description: A yellow full body suit complete with a helmet. While it does provide a modicum of protection against common dangers, such as bullets, its main use to shield its wearer against the invisible, and almost omnipresent, danger of radiation. It is quite rare and expensive as few groups in the wasteland possess the knowledge to create these suits.

ThingDef.label: Red Rocket Overalls
ThingDef.description: Overalls worn by the workers of the Red Rocket gas stations.

ThingDef.label: Naughty Nightgown
ThingDef.description: A set of leopard print pajamas.

ThingDef.label: Naughty Nightwear
ThingDef.description: A set of leopard print pajamas.

ThingDef.label: Fancy Gambler Dress
ThingDef.description: A worn brown dress with slingback high-heels.

ThingDef.label: Fancy Gambler Suit
ThingDef.description: A tan blazer with brown lapels and slacks, complete with a dark brown bow tie.

ThingDef.label: Lab Coat Capital
ThingDef.description: A clean white lab coat with a blue undershirt and a brown tie. It provides a bonus to Intelligence while worn.

ThingDef.label: Lab Coat Commonwealth
ThingDef.description: A lab coat with a dosimeter on the left breast and with a white undershirt and a black tie. It provides a bonus to Intelligence while worn

ThingDef.label: Mistress Mystery Costume
ThingDef.description: The outfit worn by the Mistress of Mystery, one of the longest-running and most popular superhero characters in the Hubris Comics universe.

ThingDef.label: Grognak Female
ThingDef.description: A loincloth with a leather made bra.

ThingDef.label: Grognak Male
ThingDef.description: A loincloth.

ThingDef.label: The Inspector Costume
ThingDef.description: A costume version of the outfit worn by The Inspector, a Hubris Comics superhero and member of The Unstoppables!

ThingDef.label: Silver Shroud Costume
ThingDef.description: A recreation of the costume worn by the comic book character, the Silver Shroud.

ThingDef.label: Manta Man Costume
ThingDef.description: An outfit stylized to resemble that of the Hubris Comics superhero Manta Man.

ThingDef.label: Athletic Outfit
ThingDef.description: A tattered and stitched baseball uniform with boots and knee pads, as they were common before the war. On its belt are pouches for storage. Itâ€™s not exactly a real armor and provides only a little protection but better than nothing.

ThingDef.label: Brahmin Skin Outfit
ThingDef.description: A basic outfit consisting of a (more or less) white shirt and patched overalls with Y-shaped suspenders complete with boots. The overalls are made of brahmin skin and are a common sight on ranches, farmsteads, and other areas where brahmins are held as livestock. Pretty basic clothing, cheap and widely available, but not very protective.

ThingDef.label: Caravaneer Outfit
ThingDef.description: Rugged and sturdy clothing, often worn by caravaneers and other travellers. It does not provide a whole lot of protection but does not weigh down its wearer and is relatively common.

ThingDef.label: Field Hand Female Outfit
ThingDef.description: Sturdy work clothes often worn by those settlers who make a living toiling in the fields. Lightweight and easy to make, this outfit is made to withstand the elements, not bullets (or claws and teeth).

ThingDef.label: Field Hand Male Outfit
ThingDef.description: Sturdy work clothes often worn by those settlers who make a living toiling in the fields. Lightweight and easy to make, this outfit is made to withstand the elements, not bullets (or claws and teeth).

ThingDef.label: Gas Ranger Outfit
ThingDef.description: Outfit invented by Rick, i don't know how to describe it, i'll ask him maybe

ThingDef.label: Followers Lab Coat
ThingDef.description: A lab coat worn by the followers of the apocalypse. It provides a bonus to science and medicine while worn.

ThingDef.label: Leather Coat
ThingDef.description: An ankle length coat, made from leather. It has a belt which is made from the seat belt of an airplane or a car. Itâ€™s mostly seen worn by settlers and other civilians. However, itâ€™s clothing, not armour and does not protect well against bullets.

ThingDef.label: Merc Adventurer Outfit
ThingDef.description: An outfit composed of a leather jacket with torn-off sleeves, a red sweater underneath a pair of brown pants and sturdy boots. Itâ€™s often worn by roving people and is designed to guarantee unimpaired freedom of movement, while still providing more protection than regular clothing.

ThingDef.label: Merc Charmer Dress
ThingDef.description: A gray-blue suit top with a matching mini-skirt and ripped black fishnet tights.

ThingDef.label: Merc Charmer Suit
ThingDef.description: A faded teal suit jacket and pants with a gray shirt underneath, as well as a strange collar that protects the neck.

ThingDef.label: Merc Cruiser Outfit
ThingDef.description: A long leather jacket with the sleeves removed with a white t-shirt underneath, as well as some black pants and dark boots. Like other merc outfits, it provides less protection than full-on armor, but more than regular clothing and doesnâ€™t weigh down its wearer much.

ThingDef.label: Prospector Outfit
ThingDef.description: This outfit consists of denim overalls, a brown satchel, and a long tan sleeve shirt underneath, as well as a pair of half boots. As its name implies, itâ€™s most often worn by the prospectors rummaging through the ruins of the old world. As such it is designed to provide protection against dust storms and other hazards, not against bullets or beasts.

ThingDef.label: Regulator Duster
ThingDef.description: An outfit consisting of a black undershirt and a pair of gray canvas pants underneath a long, brown leather overcoat with the sleeves rolled up above the elbow.

ThingDef.label: Settler Female Outfit
ThingDef.description: An outfit often associated with the wild frontier; these robust clothes are often seen worn by those living further away from the last strongholds of civilisation. While they are sturdy, they are not exactly protective against bullets, knives, teeth, stingers, or claws.

ThingDef.label: Settler Male Outfit
ThingDef.description: An outfit often associated with the wild frontier; these robust clothes are often seen worn by those living further away from the last strongholds of civilisation. While they are sturdy, they are not exactly protective against bullets, knives, teeth, stingers, or claws.

ThingDef.label: Sheriff Duster
ThingDef.description: An outfit consisting of a black undershirt and a pair of gray canvas pants underneath a long, brown leather overcoat with the sleeves rolled up above the elbow. It sports a sheriff badge on the right breast.

ThingDef.label: Surveyor Outfit
ThingDef.description: A pocketed leather coat with brown cargo pants and dirty wingtip shoes, with a satchel and metal wire covering the right arm. This outfit is often worn by scouts who roam the vast wasteland to find suitable locations for new settlements. While this is certainly a highly dangerous task, these clothes provide little protection.

ThingDef.label: Wasteland Doctor Outfit
ThingDef.description: The wasteland doctor fatigues consist of a white t-shirt for males, usually bloodstained; a small brown satchel bag, and brown cargo pants with pouches attached to the belt, and boots. Its most often seen worn by doctors, or any people with some medical training, as real doctors a rarity in the wastes. These are work clothes and provide little protection.

ThingDef.label: Wasteland Wanderer Outfit
ThingDef.description: It consists of a tan zipped-up hoodie and cargo pants tucked into riding boots. Due to its low cost and wide avail, it is very common to find, but provides little to no protection from any real danger.

ThingDef.label: Jason Bright Costume
ThingDef.description: Outfit worn by Jason Bright, it appears to resemble a weathered fancy gambler suit, without the tie.

ThingDef.label: Bright Brotherhood Robe
ThingDef.description: These are robes worn by Bright Follower ghouls. They are slightly tattered and have a brownish-green color.

ThingDef.label: Chained Prostitute Outfit
ThingDef.description: It appears as bondage harness on the chest with multiple leather bracelets and armbands. The bottom consists of a pair of low-rise, black leather pants.

ThingDef.label: Exposed Prostitute Outfit
ThingDef.description: This outfit consists of black cowboy boots, black ripped tights worn under gray boxers, chains covering the wearer's chest which are connected to a spiked choker necklace, and a wrestling singlet.

ThingDef.label: Prostitute Outfit Female
ThingDef.description: This female outfit consists of a black leather crop-top with purple lacing down the sides of the sleeves and black leather lace-up short-shorts finished with a studded belt and spiked collar.

ThingDef.label: Prostitute Outfit Male
ThingDef.description: This male outfit consists of a sheriff's vest complete with the badge, jean short-shorts and cowboy boots.

ThingDef.label: Slave Rags
ThingDef.description: Worn by slaves of the Legion, slave rags offer no protection from the elements and are composed of a torn dirty white tunic with a red "X" painted on the chest.
